title: Understanding SQL Tables
text: In SQL, a table is a collection of related data entries and it consists of columns and rows. Each column in a table represents a specific field of data.

title: Identifying SQL Column
text: What does a column represent in a database table?

title: SQL Data Types
text: In SQL, each column in a table is assigned a data type, which defines the kind of data it can hold, such as integers, strings, or dates.

title: SQL Data Type Example
text: Which of the following is a valid SQL data type?

title: SQL Query Structure
text: A basic SQL query consists of a SELECT statement, which is used to retrieve data from a database. It can be followed by clauses like WHERE, ORDER BY, and GROUP BY to filter and organize the data.

hintAnswer: Retrieves the names of employees in the Sales department
title: SQL Query Example
text: What does the following SQL query do? SELECT name FROM employees WHERE department $$=$$ 'Sales';
choices: Retrieves the names of employees in the Sales department
Retrieves all employees in the Sales department
Retrieves the department names from the employees table
Retrieves all data from the employees table
